item.title: Large deep pothole near to several other potholes, 15th February
item.description:
On Leckhampton Hill road on left of carriageway heading down towards Cheltenham before the turning into the Ullenwood Court development. Mud from building development also problematic in this area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold

item.title: As reported before, pedestrian area flooding, drains are either blocked or damaged, 15th February
item.description:
This same issue was reported earlier this year, was investigated and closed - but importantly no action has been taken. There are drains there in a relatively new pedestrianisation scheme outside John Lewis. It needs sorting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, High Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deepening and wide pothole appearing again on south side of highway., 15th February
item.description:
South side of highway where the wide Charlton Lane meets the narrower Greenhills Road making the location even more dangerous. This pothole keeps reappearing and the repair method is clearly not good enough, a more substantial and permanent repair is self evidently required, as I believe other contributors have said.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Greenhills Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Directly opposite house Number 47. The resulting flood, that doesn't flow awat, extends either side of the drain.

item.title: Gaping hole left by displaced cover, 15th February
item.description:
South side Eastern end approx 60 yds from junction with Albert road. Hole large enough to cause injury. I consider it dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hill Court Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Sustained damage problem, 15th February
item.description:
Good morning, This morning I noticed a broken bollard outside HSBC on Cheltenham high street. The bollard is lying at the edge of the road and there is about 6 inches left sticking up out of the pavement. Could this please be made safe as soon as possible? Even a cone on top of it would help as a temporary measure so no one trips or breaks their foot on it. Iâ€™ve CCed in Townscape in case it falls under their responsibility.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Man(person?)hole/cover subsidence., 15th February
item.description:
The personhole cover (I wouldn't want the problem ignored because I misgendered it) has been subsiding for a while and seems to be getting worse. The pothole/subsidence is in the road, as can be seen from the pics if they uploaded, outside number 54 Charlton Lane Leckhampton. As far as I recall it connects to a main surface water sewer, but there is also a culverted stream that runs nearby ( 5 to 10 meters towards Pilley Bridge direction), which I thought might possibly be related to the issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Charlton Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 15th February
item.description:
Customer states that the water company are at the location, there is a water leak/burst water main. Water company is there dealing with the water leak but state there is a blocked gully and the hole is filling up. The water is being pumped out but the water main cannot be fixed or filled until the gully is clear. Customer has requested contact and a visit as soon as possible to look at this issue as water is gushing out.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lighting issues in Heritage Watch, 15th February
item.description:
The only lights in the Minster grounds that are working are 2, 7 and 8. All others including floor uplighers, bench lighting and ancillary lights are not working. Noticed that some of the lampost housings have water in them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
The drain near 40 Evesham Road is blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21,23, Evesham Road, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Missing road markings, 15th February
item.description:
Following the recent resurfacing of a road section. The road markings have not been applied and are missing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 133, Alstone Lane, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Old Bath Road, northbound on mini-roundabout, immediately by Sandford Road eastbound exit., 15th February
item.description:
Potholes between the roundabout white disc marking and the Sandford Road 'give way' line. As northbound vehicles take the right-hand bend at this point, potholes cause bad jarring which affects roadholding. At most hours of the day it is impossible to swerve around them by driving straight across the humped white disc which is a discomfort in itself. Recent work was done to repair potholes in the southbound carriageway just feet away and it's bizarre that the worst northbound potholes weren't dealt with at the same time. Thanks in advance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandford Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Harp Hill; Multiple potholes, especially between Battledown Families Centre and junction with Camp Road, 15th February
item.description:
Too many individual failures to list separately. They have been present and worsening for years. Vehicles need extra traction to hold the road because of curvature and steep gradient, but handling my car safely up and down Harp Hill (which I use almost every day) has become extremely challenging. During most hours of the day, oncoming traffic prevents swerving to avoid the worst potholes but some motorists still attempt to do this causing me to brake sharply. The few remedial repairs done in recent years haven't lasted. Traffic is increasing because of new development. Some trenches dug in Harp Hill by utility companies have not been properly made good afterwards and can cause 'tramlining'. If these defects are not attended to, or better still the whole road resurfaced as well as you've recently done in St. Pauls Road and Pittville Circus, Harp Hill will become unsafe very soon and it needs to be prioritised. Thanks in advance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanley Road, Battledown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Naunton Way, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Excessive gravel & run off spoil leading to instant overspill, 14th February
item.description:
A drain between #7/9 is full of gravel/road debris, as are the ones higher up the road. Even light rain causes an overspill with accelerating water at volume flowing down the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Naunton Way, Naunton, Cheltenham
